pullRequest.body:
Definitions of sub-Gaussian and conditionally sub-Gaussian, both as special cases of a definition of sub-Gaussian with respect to a kernel and a measure.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [ ] depends on: #22622

See #22433 for the Azuma-Hoeffding inequality for sub-Gaussian random variables.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e6783f5d3e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22623/commits/e6783f5d3ea6e5c155a54840a9607dff99f800e1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Moments.SubGaussian` (new file)|2269|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasCondSubgaussianMGF`
`+ HasCondSubgaussianMGF.condExp_le`
`+ HasCondSubgaussianMGF.fun_zero`
`+ HasCondSubgaussianMGF.integrable_exp_mul`
`+ HasCondSubgaussianMGF.memLp`
`+ HasCondSubgaussianMGF.zero`
`+ HasSubgaussianMGF`
`+ HasSubgaussianMGF_iff_kernel`
`+ _root_.ProbabilityTheory.Kernel.HasSubgaussianMGF_congr`
`+ ae_aestronglyMeasurable`
`+ ae_forall_integrable_exp_mul`
`+ ae_integrable_exp_mul`
`+ congr`
`+ measure_ge_le_exp_add`
`+ prodMkLeft_comp_compProd`
`+ toReal_prob_le_one`
`++ Kernel.HasSubgaussianMGF`
`++ aestronglyMeasurable`
`++ cgf_le`
`++ fun_zero`
`++ measure_ge_le`
`++ memLp`
`++ of_rat`
`++ prob_ge_le`
`++ zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22622~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thank you, that's great! Mostly small suggestions with a nice golf for `zero`, I'll get to the conditional part later.
Thank you, that's great! Mostly small suggestions with a nice golf for `zero`, I'll get to the conditional part later.

You can do this directly (I also dropped the `Measure` namespace)
```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê snd_compProd Œº Œ∫, Kernel.prodMkLeft, snd, ‚Üê deterministic_comp_eq_map measurable_snd,
    comp_assoc, Kernel.comp_deterministic_eq_comap]
```

Does this change the rendering in the docs? if not it's nicer to read in the code.
```suggestion
* [R. Vershynin, *High-dimensional probability: An introduction with applications in data
  science*][vershynin2018high]
```

The `simp` + `exact` combo can often be replaced by `simpa`.
```suggestion
  simpa using (aemeasurable_of_aemeasurable_exp h_int.1.aemeasurable).aestronglyMeasurable
```

Yes I know! It's just that while doing that kind of proof I `simp` something to simplify it, then remark that I am able to close the goal with `exact`, and I don't take the trouble to backtrack to see if I could merge some lines.
But thanks for those improvements!

```suggestion
  filter_upwards [h_int] with œâ h_int
  simpa using (aemeasurable_of_aemeasurable_exp h_int.1.aemeasurable).aestronglyMeasurable
```

You can also do that if you want:
```suggestion
  have h_int (n : ‚Ñ§) : ‚àÄ·µê œâ' ‚àÇŒΩ, Integrable (fun œâ ‚Ü¶ exp (n * X œâ)) (Œ∫ œâ') :=
    h.ae_integrable_exp_mul _
```

```suggestion
  ¬∑ simpa [hp0] using (h.integrable_exp_mul t).1
```

There is already a `p` here.
```suggestion
    convert h' using 3 with œâ
```

```suggestion
    ¬∑ simpa [h0] using by positivity
```

You don't need `of_rat` here. Also should the name be `fun_zero` and the one below just `zero`?
```suggestion
lemma zero [IsFiniteMeasure ŒΩ] [IsZeroOrMarkovKernel Œ∫] :
    HasSubgaussianMGF (fun _ ‚Ü¶ 0) 0 Œ∫ ŒΩ where
  integrable_exp_mul := by simp
  mgf_le := by simpa using ae_of_all _ fun _ ‚Ü¶ toReal_prob_le_one
```

NIce golf! The definition I had changed something like 4 times, so perhaps `of_rat` was useful at some point? Perhaps not!

I'll change the names, good catch. That code was written before the outcome of that unfortunate poll.

```suggestion
    filter_upwards [h'] with œâ hœâ using by rw [hœâ]
```

```suggestion
  ‚ü®fun hX ‚Ü¶ congr hX h, fun hY ‚Ü¶ congr hY (ae_eq_symm h)‚ü©
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Probability): (conditionally) sub-Gaussian random variables

source.title: feat(Probability): Azuma-Hoeffding inequality for sub-Gaussian random variables
